item.title: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures
item.description: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures Briefcase full of U.S. currency. (Getty Images) Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures The benefits of cybercrime aren't all flashy cars and watches. Sophos X-Ops researchers discovered it also fuels a far-reaching mix of ordinary, sometimes unremarkable businesses. By Matt Kapko

item.title: Critical infrastructure security tech needs to be as good as our smartphones, top NSC cyber official says
item.description: Critical infrastructure security tech needs to be as good as our smartphones, top NSC cyber official says Bulazel mentioned the energy sector in particular, given the potential for hackers to turn off the power in the United States. It’s a sector that relies in large measure on supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems to monitor and control industrial processes. (Image Credit: AndreyPopov via Getty Images) Critical infrastructure security tech needs to be as good as our smartphones, top NSC cyber official says

item.description: Swivel is putting AI agents to work for publishers, automating the messy middle of ad ops so teams can focus on strategy. From faster troubleshooting to smarter workflows, here’s how they’re reshaping the sell-side playbook.

item.title: Vercel Introduces AI Gateway for Multi-Model Integration
item.description:
Vercel has rolled out the AI Gateway for production workloads. The service provides a single API endpoint for accessing a wide range of large language and generative models, aiming to simplify integration and management for developers.

By Daniel Dominguez

item.title: Samsung Fixes Critical Zero-Day CVE-2025-21043 Exploited in Android Attacks
item.description: Samsung has released its monthly security updates for Android, including a fix for a security vulnerability that it said has been exploited in zero-day attacks. The vulnerability, CVE-2025-21043 (CVSS score: 8.8), concerns an out-of-bounds write that could result in arbitrary code execution. "Out-of-bounds Write in libimagecodec.quram.so prior to SMR Sep-2025 Release 1 allows remote attackers to
